heading: The Science Of Powder Blending
text: Dry powder blending is a big fucking deal in industries like food, materials, and pharmaceuticals. Thanks to the Barr Laboratory court case in 1993, everyone is paying attention to it. A survey by BUWG of PQRI found that direct compression is the main method for dosage form development, followed by wet granulation and dry granulation. If the blending process isn't efficient and reproducible, it can lead to a non-homogenous mixture and rejection of the final product. This can happen because of poor flowability, segregation, inappropriate blending equipment, agglomeration, and softening. Blending is a pain in the ass and requires a lot of energy, and the type of materials used can make it even harder. Cohesive materials are a bitch to work with, but they're often used in pharmaceuticals because they promote dissolution. So, it's important to choose a mixing technique that minimizes cohesiveness and maximizes surface area.

heading: Mechanisms And Factors Influencing The Process
text: Dry powder coating is a process that involves physical and chemical forces between guest and carrier particles. The process involves three stages: deagglomeration, adhesion, and redistribution. Different terms are used to describe this process, including hybrid mixing, composite powder formation, and encapsulation. The degree of coverage varies from loose surface coating to complete surface coverage. The type and extent of dry powder coating depend on the physical properties of the guest material. The relationship between guest and carrier size is crucial for uniform coating. The carrier particle size has a crucial effect on improving flowability. The roughness of the particle surface affects adhesion behavior. The process produces functionalized particles with reduced cohesiveness.

heading: Advantages Of Dry Powder Coating Technique
text: Dry powder coating is a fucking amazing technique for blending fine APIs. It makes a homogenous, free-flowing mixture that's easy to work with. Plus, the particles it produces have all sorts of enhanced properties like better flowability, solubility, and wettability. And if you want to make your shit look or taste better, it can do that too. Best of all, it's cheap as fuck and doesn't require any extra materials or solvents. Plus, it's eco-friendly and saves energy. And if you're worried about contamination, don't be, because there's no milling medium required. This process is a goddamn no-brainer.

heading: High Impact Devices
text: This fucking Japanese research group came up with a device called Angmill® in the 1980s for dry powder coating. They modified it to create the Mechanofusion® device, which is a rotating cylindrical processing vessel with a fixed scraper blade and inner-piece that applies mechanical and shear forces to the powder bed. This shit generates a fuck ton of thermo-mechanical energy and creates a uniform layer of the guest material over the carrier. Then, they developed the Hybridizer® which uses high shear impaction force to break agglomerates into primary fine powder. This device has a processing chamber with six blades and a powder recirculation circuit, and it generates heat through fucking friction.

heading: Mild Dry Powder Coating Devices
text: Several dry powder coating blenders were introduced that provide mild coating conditions. The Elliptical rotor mixer (Theta Composer ® ) and Magnetically assisted impaction coating (MAIC ® ) are devices that use high shear force and compression to coat particles. The Rotating Fluidised Bed Coater (RFBC ® ) uses centrifugal and shear forces to facilitate coating. Surface particle coating with particle micronisation using fluid energy mill (FEM ® ) is best used for cohesive materials with particle size <25µm. However, these devices have limitations such as heat generation, particle attrition, and possible changes to the chemical and electronic status of the components. The Hosokawa-Japan [26,40] Hybridizer produces chemical and physical interaction between host and guest, but also has limitations such as heat generation and particle attrition.

text: This fucking process involves micronisation and coating for tiny ass particles. It's a continuous process that involves increasing the surface energy of the carrier particles and then using guest particles with low energy to calm that shit down. The particles produced are weak as fuck compared to other methods and can easily break down or turn into some other bullshit. You gotta mix the guest and carrier beforehand and keep an eye on a bunch of variables like feeding rate and grinding pressure to make sure you get the particles you want.

heading: Enhanced Flowability
text: The fucking flowability of dry powder is crucial in pharmaceutical operations, but it's a fucking challenge to enhance the flow properties of API with size less than 50µm. Flow aids are a fucking pain in the ass because they cause segregation and inconsistency of the powder bed. Granulation is a fucking nightmare because it jeopardizes the surface area available for dissolution and requires multiple processing stages. Dry powder coating is a fucking solution to produce functionalized blend with enhanced flowability by reducing the intrinsic cohesion of the fine powder. Nano-additives may result in a neutralizing effect of the electrostatic charges on carrier particles. Dry powder coating was employed to produce nano-scale surface roughness of cohesive API that led to a reduction of cohesive force within the powder bed and enhancement of flowability.

text: The fucking absorption of poorly soluble drugs is a fucking problem because it's fucking slow. So, they fucking try to enhance the dissolution rate of the fucking API to make it absorb faster. But, when they fucking reduce the particle size of the API, it fucking causes manufacturing problems because the fucking powder becomes cohesive and doesn't fucking flow well. The fucking solubility of the carrier material also fucking affects the dissolution rate, with soluble carriers enhancing it and less soluble carriers slowing it down. They fucking use a triturating agent to reduce the dissolution rate of the drug, which is fucking common practice. They fucking use different strategies to enhance the dissolution profile, like optimising the particle size and concentration of the drug, adding surfactants, or using different types of excipients. They fucking use interactive mixtures to increase the dissolution of sparingly soluble drugs by mixing them with a water-soluble carrier. They fucking investigated a dual process to enhance the dissolution of ibuprofen, which included micronisation of the API followed by dry coating using FEM® to produce API particles dry coated with the nano-silica. Tablets compacted from the blend with high API loading resulted in dissolution profiles that produced 80% release in less than 5 minutes.

heading: Challenges
text: Dry powder coating is a fucking nightmare. It's a one-step technique, but there are so many fucking challenges to deal with. The materials used and the type of instrument used can affect the degree of surface coating and the homogeneity of the mixture. And don't even get me started on the fucking heat generated by some of these dry coating technologies. It can fuck up the stability of thermo labile actives and cause polymorphic and amorphous transformations that can fuck up the safety of components. And if you think that's bad, some of these technologies like MAIC® can introduce fucking contaminants. Moisture content is also a fucking issue, affecting the coating process and either stabilizing or destabilizing the dry coated functionalized particles. It's a fucking mess.

heading: Expert Opinion
text: The pharmaceutical industry faces major challenges with cohesive and insoluble APIs and excipients that have poor flowability. However, dry coating offers a promising solution by adsorbing fine guest particles onto a coarse carrier surface, improving flowability, dose uniformity, and reproducible manufacturing. This technique is cost-effective, sustainable, and environmentally friendly, with tangible benefits for flowability, dissolution rate, and blend homogeneity. The potential for developing age-appropriate formulations without complicated multi-stage processing is enormous. However, progress has been hampered by a lack of detailed studies and benchmark models. Greater attention needs to be given to dry particle coating, including understanding the role of surface texture and exploring suitable analytical techniques.
